intro: Paepalanthus helodes, commonly known as the golden cup-moss, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that emerge from the center of the leaf rosette. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
